metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4623 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The x509parse_crt function in x509.h in PolarSSL 1.1.x before 1.1.7 and1.2.x before 1.2.8 does not properly parse certificate messages during theSSL/TLS handshake, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (infinite loop and CPU consumption) via a certificate message thatcontains a PEM encoded certificate.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4623` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmbedcrypto0 - 1.2.8-2
libmbedtls10 - 1.2.8-2
libmbedx509-0 - 1.2.8-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mbedtls package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.8-2').
